items.title: Live: Trump says Venezuela's acting president must 'do what's right' or pay 'bigger price' than Maduro
items.description: It comes as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio says discussions of Venezuela holding elections following Nicolás Maduro's ouster are "premature", with Washington focused on ensuring Caracas now carries out policy changes.

items.title: Maduro allies now ruling Venezuela reject US claims they will 'comply'
items.description: The Trump administration insists Venezuela's leaders will now comply with American demands after the extraordinary capture of president Nicolás Maduro — but his allies are resisting US pressure.

items.title: Were the US actions in Venezuela legal under international law?
items.description: International law is created by all states, not just the powerful few. This makes international community reactions to breaches particularly important.

items.title: Live: Australia desperate for wickets as Root, Brook resume mammoth partnership
items.description: England builds towards an imposing first-innings total on day two of the SCG Ashes Test after rain and bad light brought an early end to day one. Follow live.

items.title: Damien Martyn awakes from coma in 'some sort of miracle', thanks public
items.description: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

items.title: Djokovic quits players body he co-founded over transparency concerns
items.description: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association, citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

items.title: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?
items.description: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

items.title: Live: Oil prices on watch after US strikes on Venezuela
items.description: Australian shares are set to edge higher at open, with energy stocks expected to be in focus after the US strike on Venezuela sparked concerns about oil supplies. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

items.title: The island in Japan 'whose name cannot be spoken'
items.description: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

items.title: League president reported to AFL over 'gender weirdness' alleged comments
items.description: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

items.title: The signs your child might have a developmental delay
items.description: Developmental delay will be a big part of the new NDIS alternative for some kids. But what does the phrase mean and how can you tell if your child has one?

items.title: The hidden injuries linked to memory changes in family violence survivors
items.description: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

items.title: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice
items.description: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

items.title: Lower crime rates in Alice Springs leave many optimistic, others worried
items.description: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

items.title: Patient says 'traumatising' hospital care deepened her mental health crisis
items.description: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

items.title: Tears for Thanasi, grins for Nick as Special Ks make their return
items.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

items.title: Kasatkina determined to 'pay back' Australia after emotional home debut
items.description: Daria Kasatkina admits she held back tears and dealt with severe nerves during an agonising three-set loss at the Brisbane International.

items.title: Scoring a spot at this cookbook club is like trying to get Taylor Swift tickets
items.description: Each month, strangers and friends meet to share dishes from a chosen cookbook. But Cookbook Club Naarm is more than a foodie feast, it's a reminder of food's power to bring us together.

items.title: Woman who paid back debt faces community housing eviction amid 'other factors'
items.description: Community housing is seen as a way for the government to tackle the housing crisis, but between limited options and court orders, some people are falling through the cracks.

items.title: Residents in WA city warn of e-scooter dangers ahead of contract decision
items.description: Geraldton locals like Stuart Wise are calling for a crackdown on e-scooter safety, weeks after a man in his 30s died in an accident in the regional WA city.

items.title: Inflation, tariffs, EVs: What the ABC's business experts are watching in 2026
items.description: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

items.title: Sustainable timber certification under fire
items.description: Questions are being raised about sustainable timber certification in Australia.

items.title: City-bound lanes of Adelaide freeway reopen after motorbike crash
items.description: A serious motorcycle crash at Crafers West caused major traffic disruptions on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway, with all city-bound lanes closed before reopening several hours after the incident.

items.title: 'I could have been where they are': Aussie teen loses friend in Swiss bar fire
items.description: Yaron Lavy, from Melbourne, says he had planned to join friends at the Le Constellation bar on New Year's Eve but stopped to get water — a decision that may have saved his life.

items.title: Death toll rises in Iran as anti-government protests spread
items.description: At least 16 people have been killed in a week of demonstrations fuelled by the rising cost of living.
